pages.title: Definition
descriptions: Structured Query Language (SQL)
A programming language designed for managing and manipulating relational databases.
It serves as a standard for interacting with database management systems (DBMS), enabling users to create, retrieve, update, and delete data.
SQL is renowned for its simplicity and declarative nature, allowing users to express complex operations on a database with concise and human-readable syntax.

pages.title: Where is used
descriptions: SQL is used to communicate with and manage relational databases
SQL is utilized by developers, database administrators, and data analysts across industries to maintain, organize, and analyze vast datasets efficiently.

pages.title: Why to learn
descriptions: SQL is a standard language for interacting with relational databases, and its principles are implemented in various database management systems such as MySQL, PostgreSQL, SQLite, Microsoft SQL Server, and Oracle.
Regardless of the specific database technology employed, SQL provides a consistent and essential skillset that is highly transferable, making it a valuable asset in a variety of professional roles

pages.title: Installing a Database Management System (DBMS)
descriptions: Learn how to install a DBMS, such as MySQL or PostgreSQL, to create and manage databases locally.
Understand the importance of selecting the right DBMS for your specific needs.

pages.title: Introduction to SQL Clients
descriptions: Explore SQL clients like MySQL Workbench or DBeaver for interacting with databases visually.
Learn the basics of connecting to a database using SQL clients.

pages.title: Creating Your First Database
descriptions: Understand the structure of a database and how to create one using SQL.
Practice creating tables and defining relationships between them.

pages.title: Introduction to SELECT Statement
descriptions: Learn the fundamental SELECT statement for retrieving data from tables.
Understand the syntax and use of SELECT to filter and sort data.

pages.title: Filtering Data with WHERE Clause
descriptions: Dive into the WHERE clause to filter data based on specific conditions.
Practice using logical operators to refine your queries.

pages.title: Sorting and Grouping Data
descriptions: Explore ORDER BY for sorting data and GROUP BY for grouping results.
Learn how to use aggregate functions like COUNT, SUM, AVG, and MAX.

pages.title: Inserting Data
descriptions: Understand the INSERT statement for adding new records to a table.
Practice inserting data into tables with various data types.

pages.title: Updating and Deleting Data
descriptions: Explore the UPDATE statement for modifying existing records.
Learn the DELETE statement for removing records from a table.

pages.title: Transactions and Rollbacks
descriptions: Understand the concept of transactions for maintaining data integrity.
Learn how to use the ROLLBACK statement to undo changes in case of errors.

pages.title: Understanding Relationships
descriptions: Explore the concept of relationships between tables.
Understand primary keys, foreign keys, and their role in database design.

pages.title: INNER JOIN and LEFT JOIN
descriptions: Learn the INNER JOIN and LEFT JOIN operations for combining data from multiple tables.
Practice writing JOIN queries to retrieve related information.

pages.title: Advanced Joins and Subqueries
descriptions: Dive into more complex joins like RIGHT JOIN and FULL OUTER JOIN.
Explore the use of subqueries for performing nested queries.
